speaker: Doctor
text: Can you tell me more about the duration of your symptoms? When did you first notice the chronic cough and the weight loss?

speaker: Patient
text: "I think it started about 6 months ago, after I got out of prison. I had been feeling pretty weak and tired all the time, and then I started having this persistent cough that wouldn't go away. The weight loss just sort of crept up on me over time."

speaker: Doctor
text: Can you tell me more about the duration of your weight loss? Was it a gradual process or did you notice a sudden decline in your appetite or overall health?

speaker: Patient
text: "It was a gradual process, to be honest. At first, I didn't even notice I was losing weight, but over time, I started to feel it. I'd look in the mirror and think, 'I've lost a bit more than I thought.' It was only when I went to the doctor last month that I realized I'd lost over 7.5 kg – that's when I started to worry about what was going on."

speaker: Doctor
text:

Also, I'd like to request a test: REQUEST TEST: Complete_Blood_Count

speaker: Doctor
text:
I'd like to examine your chest and lungs further. Can you please take a deep breath in and out for me, and then I'd like to listen to your lungs with my stethoscope?

And to follow up on your test request, I'll also like to request an X-ray of your chest to get a better view of your lungs.

Also, can you tell me more about your energy levels? Have you noticed a decrease in your ability to perform daily activities or maintain your usual routine due to your symptoms?

speaker: Patient
text: "Ah, yeah, I've been having trouble keeping up with my usual routine. I used to be able to walk a few miles without getting tired, but now I get winded after just a few blocks. I've also had to cut back on my work hours, which is frustrating because I want to get back to my normal life."

speaker: Doctor
text:
You've been experiencing these symptoms for approximately 6 months now, with the cough being the most persistent. The weight loss has been a gradual process, but I've noticed a significant decline in my appetite over the past 3 months.

Can you tell me more about your energy levels? How would you describe your ability to perform daily activities, such as household chores or even just getting dressed in the morning?

speaker: Patient
text: "It's been really tough, to be honest. I used to be able to do most things without getting too tired, but now I find myself needing to take a lot of breaks just to get through the day. Even simple tasks like cooking dinner or cleaning the house are starting to feel like big challenges."

speaker: Doctor
text: Can you tell me more about your sleep patterns? Are you experiencing any insomnia or do you find it difficult to fall asleep at night?

speaker: Patient
text: "To be honest, I've been having trouble sleeping a lot lately. I'll go to bed okay, but then I'll wake up multiple times during the night, feeling tired and stuffy. It's like I'm not getting the rest I need, even when I'm lying down."

speaker: Doctor
text:

Also, when you take a deep breath in, I want you to hold it for a few seconds and then exhale slowly. I'm listening to your lungs now.
